page.title: 02FARMING.DAIRY FARMING
page.content: Mr Leckenby,who lives at Seave Green Farm has 20 cows now but he did have 24.His cows live on 48 acres and he works 12 hours every day.Mrs Leckenby or Mr Flintoft milks for him when he is ill.His cows eat barley,hay,kale and grass which Mr Leckenby grows.Each cow gives about 5-6 gallons of milk a day and the collection tanker calls at 12.00 midday.The most common ailment is Mastitis and most of his calves are born without him being there.When he goes to Mart he goes to Northallerton about twice a year.Milking in the winter is difficult and Mr Leckenby has thought of arable farming.He has had 10 calves this year and keeps his milk cows about 12 years and a cow is three years old when it has a calf and gives milk.He keeps a dog to help him with his work.
